If you want to have a bad time, go to Barclays, but I'll give you an example of how you have to get your ticket stamped so that your parking is free. Review:
I don't know why all banks have these 1-2 stars reviews. But this branch was spacious and not busy at all. The employees were very friendly. And we being foreigners didn't feel any hostility or ignoring from them.
The lady that served us and her partner who speaked English very well, translated everything she said, helped us to fill all the required forms and explained what we would get by creating accounts in this bank.
We have been here about half of the hour, maybe a little more and I thought that maybe people just don't understand that processing all documents and forms while creating back accounts isn't a minute deal so they become impatient and angry this creating these low reviews.
Moreover we left with our cards ready instantly. In Europe and Russia we need to wait our cards to be prepared for about few days. But here we got everything ready in one day of visit.

Highly recommending this branch and thanking its staff again! Muchos Gracias!.

And we being foreigners didn't feel any hostility or ignoring them. The lady that served us and her partner who spoke English very well, translated everything she said, helped us to fill out all the required forms and explained what we would get by creating accounts in this bank. We have been here about half of the hour, maybe a little more and I thought that maybe people just don't understand that processing all documents and forms while creating back accounts isn't a minute deal so they become impatient and angry this creating these low reviews. Moreover we left with our cards ready instantly. In Europe and Russia we need to wait for our cards to be prepared for about a few days. But here we got everything ready in one day of visit. Highly recommending this branch and thanking its staff again! Thank you very much!

traduccion_nueva: Their practices are not functional for the user, they are more useful for theft by the bank or one of its employees. I reported that a deposit I made the day before was not made and the "practica" did not return the amount to me. When I went to the bank the next day they told me that there were no leftovers, so they cannot return the money and/or carry out the transaction; I have to file a report on their telephone line and they tell me that since I am not the account holder, I cannot file the incident. So tell me, how practical are your "practicas"? Yes, in total I had to go to that branch three times, call their line and then call the condusef; losing more time and money (money due to transfers), not recovering the money deposited and I had to make another deposit to the destination account, because obviously one has commitments that cannot be delayed due to the terrible service of a bank. If they are not going to have functional equipment, in good condition, that does not fail all the time (apparently this happens a lot in that branch), it is better not to provide that "service" and allow the user to make the deposit directly at the counter. They have only given me a bad impression as a bank and I have no desire to be their customer.

Adequate convention centre for all kind of events, I found the coffee shops mediocre and a small food court wasn't even open.

If one is coming by public transport it is a bit of a nightmare to get to the place, but it is more difficult to get away, it really baffles me that all these places seem to be targeted only to car drivers, given the pollution existing in Mexico City one would have expected that a modern convention centre would have good public transport options (there is bus stop down the road, why isn't one right in front of the convention centre?)

Typical urban design for the privileged few. Will this ever change?

Review: Just went into this bank to try and withdraw dollars from the atm, as I need them for an upcoming trip to Cuba. There's no one on the front desk, so I had to line up to speak to an unbelievably rude teller who REFUSED to give me the address of their Angel branch (the only one, according to an Internet search, with an atm that dispenses dollars). I even had a lovely woman step in to help and he still wouldn't provide it, but had a terrible attitude and was totally dismissive. Fortunately, she was able to find and write it down for me, but not without him first telling her she wasn't to use her phone while in the bank. I've been a customer of HSBC in the UK for 30 years and used branches all over the world. Never have I had such an experience; in fact, I've always been super impressed with their service. I'd give this place zero stars if I could.

Review:
Arrival ‚Äì Upon arriving in Cancun, Mexico, I was surprised to find that the immigration line was long, even for US passport holders. This was unusual, as in my experience arriving at LAX International in California from Cabo San Lucas, Mexico, the customs line usually moves very quickly. If it‚Äôs your first time and you booked a private/shared ride please do not stop at the rep at the beginning of the exit. They will take all your information and try to talk you into timeshares etc‚Ä¶Instead, keep walking till you get to the bus area. Look for the transportation company.. our was Amstar.
Departure - Our flight was scheduled for 12:15 pm with boarding at 11:35 am. We arranged a private ride through Amstar from our hotel at 9:20 am and arrived at Cancun airport with no traffic at 9:45 am. We quickly checked in using a kiosk and proceeded to the security checkpoint.
Unfortunately, they did not allow any liquids, not even ice. After going through security, we walked duty-free, but the prices didn't offer much, except for tax. I wanted to buy the Tom Ford Cherry perfume, which was priced at $250, but the same one at the duty-free store was $395, which wasn't a good price.
Initially, our gate was 67D, which was nice and cool. However, there was a gate change to 60 which was located upstairs, it was quite warm around that terminal. Like all airports, everything was quite expensive, not American prices but clearly tourist prices. For example, a burger and fries cost $20.
While I was at the convenience store waiting to buy water, I watched a girl get charged $20 for Hot Cheetos and Evian water, which seemed quite expensive, lol. Anyways, the airport was sufficient and offered a good selection of souvenir shops

They will take all your information and try to talk you into timeshares etc‚Ä¶Instead, keep walking until you get to the bus area. Look for the transportation company.. our was Amstar. Review:
This is an extremely busy airport that is literally bursting at the seams. When we landed in Cancun, the exit processing was fairly quick and efficient. Our luggage was there at the carousel almost at the same time we reached. In less than 10 minutes after we disembarked we were set to exit.

That‚Äôs when the fun began!

The airport is literally teeming with all kinds of people looking to ‚Äúhelp‚Äù you. Most of them are cab drivers though there were also several tourist guides, hotel representatives, currency exchangers and many that we could not figure out. They are fairly aggressive and will pursue you relentlessly to get your attention. Since we do not know Spanish we could not understand most the stuff they were trying to sell, but their demeanor was quite intimidating.

We had arranged for a ride to pick us up (highly recommended), but there was confusion in terms of the pick up point. The driver had helpfully sent us a picture of where he was parked outside but that was of little help to us. We tried showing the picture to a few people in the airports but they tried steering us towards their contacts. Finally we sent the driver a picture of where we were waiting and he came by to pick us up. Later we realized why he was being so cautious. While Cancun allows for Uber, the airport taxi drivers have been known to physically attack them. This is why they act so surreptitiously.

Our departure from the airport was a lot smoother. The same Uber driver dropped us at the airport (he made us pay ahead of time to avoid any confusion at the airport). We were flying United and they had setup several self check in kiosks. We were able to complete the check-in and security clearance fairly quickly.

The departure area was literally overflowing with people. There are serval restaurants in the food court but all eating tables were occupied. We had to wait more than 30 minutes to order coffee at the Starbucks.

I hear they are opening a new airport in Tul√∫m and hopefully that will take away some of the crowds from here. I also hope that they implement some system to control the aggressive solicitation for incoming passengers.

Review:
I read a lot of reviews before coming here, and I was quite skeptical.
I‚Äôve traveled a lot internationally and live in the states. My husband and I came here on a busy Saturday afternoon, expecting chaos.

Before the doors of our taxi closed, there was an airport worker by our side ready to usher us in to our line. He grabbed our bags and lead the way. This was an unexpected and pleasant surprise! We got to the front of the line in a matter of minutes and past security just as quickly! We also did not need to take our shoes off and no workers were yelling directions or treating people rudely, the way they do in the states. What a wonderful change of pace!

People were friendly, polite, professional, and efficient. The airport was also clean, and workers were keeping it maintained from the food court to the bathroom.

The only negative about coming here is the prices are high for Mexico, but this is a fancier part of Mexico so it‚Äôs the norm for the entire area.

I will happily fly into this airport anytime!

The only negative about coming here is the prices are high for Mexico, but this is a fancier part of Mexico so it's the norm for the entire area. I will happily fly into this airport anytime!

Review:
5/20/24 This update went from 3 stars to only 1.
In reference to my previous travel experiences, I have decided to discontinue my travels to Mexico due to safety concerns. The practice of randomly selecting and inspecting carry-on luggage prior to boarding the aircraft raises doubts about the overall security measures in place. This lack of trust in the scanning process and the personnel responsible for operating the X-ray scanners compromises my sense of safety. A similar incident occurred at Queen Alia Airport in Jordan, which prompted me to cease all travel to and from that airport. I would like to provide an overview of what to expect upon arrival at Cancun International Airport. Passengers should be prepared for extensive walking distances between terminals and potentially long queues at immigration. However, if you possess a new passport equipped with a chip, you may utilize the self-service kiosks to expedite the process. After clearing immigration, you will proceed through customs, where you will have the option to self-declare that you are not carrying cigarettes or alcohol (left side) or declare otherwise (right side).As a helpful tip, it is recommended to pay the VISI Tax online prior to your arrival at the airport to save time. Additionally, please note that all transportation companies are not permitted inside the airport and will be waiting outside
I hope this information proves beneficial for your upcoming travels.

A similar incident occurred at Queen Alia Airport in Jordan, which prompted me to cease all travel to and from that airport. Additionally, please note that all transportation companies are not permitted inside the airport and will be waiting outside I hope this information proves beneficial for your upcoming travels.

Review:
We were flying sunwing priority plus, which was well worth it as there was no lineup for the Priority Plus check-in. Ignore the porters who want to take your bags for you, its not too far to go, and all they want is a big tip for carrying them 50ft.
BEWARE: Make sure you lock your check-in bags as my wife's was not locked, and someone went thru it and stole her jewelry!!! - take your jewelry in your carry-on.
Getting through security was quite quick, and they were telling everyone to leave their shoes on, which made it even quicker.
Once inside, we discovered the duty free was really no cheaper than buying at a store on or close to the resort.
There were quite a few places to eat but of course, like many airports, it was quite expensive, i.e., $18 CAD for a sandwich. To board our plane, we had to go outside and get on a bus which drove us to the plane. To make matters worse, it started raining pretty hard. So you're boarding a plane outside in the pouring rain.
But, still not as bad as the Toronto Airport!

BEWARE: Make sure you lock your check-in bags as my wife's was not locked, and someone went thru it and stole her jewelry!!! - take your jewelry in your carry-on. Getting through security was quite quick, and they were telling everyone to leave their shoes on, which made it even quicker. Once inside, we discovered the duty free was really no cheaper than buying at a store on or close to the resort. There were quite a few places to eat but of course, like many airports, it was quite expensive, ie, $18 CAD for a sandwich. To board our plane, we had to go outside and get on a bus which drove us to the plane. To make matters worse, it started raining pretty hard. So you're boarding a plane outside in the pouring rain. But, still not as bad as the Toronto Airport!
Bank Name: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China

Review:
Great little airport. Friendly staff that ensured a smooth check-in process. The line moved quickly as the airline was well staffed.
Security was quick and friendly. No issues.
Duty free had plenty of options - however, the price of liquor seemed expensive, know your prices. The only liquor worth purchasing is tequila not available back home.
Plenty of restaurants and food options. Many souvenir shops that offer a variety of goods. I found the prices in the gift shops were cheaper than those in our hotel shops.

Plenty of restaurants and food options. Many souvenir shops that offer a variety of goods. I found the prices in the gift shops were cheaper than those in our hotel shops.

Review:
Cancun Airport offers a unique blend of convenience and charm. While not sprawling in size, its relatively compact layout contributes to a seamless travel experience. Navigating through the airport is a breeze, with well-marked signs and helpful staff ensuring a smooth journey for passengers. The airport strikes a balance by providing essential facilities without overwhelming travelers with an excessive expanse.

Inside, Cancun Airport is adorned with an array of boutiques and restaurants, enhancing the overall travel experience. From duty-free shops offering local crafts to global brands, there's something for every shopper. The selection of restaurants caters to diverse tastes, allowing passengers to savor both local cuisine and international flavors. This culinary variety adds a touch of culinary exploration to the travel experience, making layovers or waiting times more enjoyable.

Moreover, the airport's design and ambiance reflect the vibrant spirit of Cancun itself. Bright and lively, it encapsulates the essence of the destination, offering a warm welcome or a fond farewell to visitors. The strategic layout, combined with the availability of amenities, transforms Cancun Airport into more than just a transit point‚Äîit becomes an introduction to the cultural richness and hospitality that awaits travelers in Cancun and the surrounding areas. In essence, Cancun Airport stands as a testament to the region's commitment to providing a pleasant and memorable journey for all.

Review:
Wow. The delta check in was staffed to the hilt!  Got through security in record time on a Wednesday. Yes, we were there during a slower, post spring break time (early May) but that is definitely the time to vacation without crowds at every turn.

Showing our passports 5 times along our journey to the jet way was a little annoying but easily forgiven.

Everything was smooth and relaxed. But I‚Äôve decided that I‚Äôm going to sell water in the airport in my next live because someone is getting rich doing that!

Review:
Very long lines. Rude customer service. When entering they threw my daughter‚Äôs sandwich, following some illogical rules. It‚Äôs fine if they have rules for not allowing food to enter but it makes no sense that they would not allow her to eat it. Then, these custom control ladies tore apart our suitcases for no good reason, misplacing a couple valuable items. It made for a very unpleasant arrival experience.
Upon departure, there were a lot of food choices but everything was extremely overpriced. More expensive than any other airport I‚Äôve flown through. And finally, the restrooms were in a dismal condition‚Ä¶ haven‚Äôt seen such dirty public restrooms.

Review: The resort it self did not meet our expectations. From the very beginning we had issues. After check-in we went to our assigned rooms only to find that people were already in the room that was given to us. The front desk did not believe us, so they had to send the the bellman to confirm, after confirming it took about another hour to get the room situation under control. Their advertising is also a bit deceiving. Their website promotes beautiful beaches that are not theirs, they are beaches that belong to a neighboring resort which their guest don't have access to. The resort felt really enclosed and trapped unable to go out and explore outside the resort. The prices for the parks, I thought were a bit outrageous, a park hopper at Disneyland would have been more affordable. The best part or highlight is traveling to Isla Mujeres, beautiful catamaran to and from the Island, and the Island in general is gorgeous. Definitely a learning experience and will do our homework before choosing our next trip.

Review:
Got the worst delta interviewer/security lady by terminal 3 gate C7 today around 11am-12pm, 5/23 Tuesday for my flight to New York. She was so rude and difficult to talk to.

When we were told to get some stickers for the back of our passport, she grilled me with questions that was a bit surprising, like how many people‚Äôs in my family and was there kids and how old are they, these are very basic and simple questions but what shocked me more was her attitude and tone, we‚Äôre all here for vacation and just heading home but being treated like we‚Äôre criminals? That felt really odd and my first unpleasant interaction with her.

When they started calling for boarding and people were lining up, she kept telling folks in the front to go to the side and wait by the seats (nice way of saying get out of her way) since they‚Äôre not priority. We were all still following instructions and waiting for our turn to board and she kept telling the group in front of me, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre last, go to the back and wait on the side‚Äù in a very condescending tone. Totally unnecessary, she could have politely directed folks to space out a bit if needed.

The other line to the left had a guy who was so much nicer and people went through without a problem, I think at some point because she was so mean, everyone moved to the other side to go in. I mean if you hate your job so much, don‚Äôt make it miserable for other people‚Ä¶ it was so unpleasant to have to talk or interact with her.

I felt disrespected and this was probably one the worst boarding / check in process ever. Totally didn‚Äôt need that attitude from her for me or my group or anyone nearby trying to get on the plane. I traveled a lot and usually airport staff treats customers politely, so I was still processing the experience when it happened.

I like flying with delta but this experience was awful :( maybe they just have mean security in Cancun?

Everyone else was nice though except her. Almost making me want to put delta to the bottom of the list of airlines I want to fly with going forward‚Ä¶ I seriously hope she gets better customer service training.

Thinking back, I wish I wrote down her name so I could report the feedback to delta, it was not the right way to treat customers. She was probably the meanest person we met in Cancun on this entire trip.

Bye bye Mexico!

Review: The airport staff here is not friendly at all. The wait and delays and lack of assistance leaves you feeling overwhelmed and stranded. Directions are not clear, coordination of flights, gates and departure times is inconsistent and in disarray. This has to be the most expensive airport around! With bottle water costing $8.00 US dollars and a breakfast sandwich around $17.00. Carry one bags are re-checked before your flight and items such as candy and snacks are just thrown outside your bag on the floor. It‚Äôs definitely been an experience coming through this airport.

Review:
Arrival:

The airport is modern, clean and we had a positive experience with all staff we interacted with. The washrooms were clean, lining up at customs was orderly but that's all the positives we experienced with regards to arrivals. Once we were thru customs and arrived at the luggage carousel, we were told the luggage wouldn't arrive for another 45 minutes. Soon the area became filled with hundreds of people and there is no seating so everyone began to stand around watching the luggage carousel like they were waiting for Rock stars to pop out. It was more than an hour before the first suitcase rolled by, and there were big gaps where no new luggage showed up. In total, we waited almost 2 hours from exiting customs until we recovered all of our checked baggage. We also had to wait another hour on the shuttle bus to our resort as we waited for everyone else to finish collecting their luggage. Thankfully, the rest of our vacation was amazing!

Departure:

Nothing out of the ordinary, it was like any other North American airport. Staff helped at check in, check luggage, airport security was orderly and everyone was nice. Food in this airport is more expensive than others but there were a lot of choices.

Overall, if the baggage didn't take as long as it did, I would rate this airport with 5 stars, but that extra 3 hours of waiting killed off 3 stars for me.

Review:
Horrible experience!
When you arrive at the airport and want to leave the premises, you will be guided to the exit. there are two different exits. one for ‚Äúfamily and friends‚Äù and one for tourists. (Photo attached) But as a tourist you can't just use the exit for ‚Äûfamily and friends‚Äú because it's cordoned off and someone is standing in front of it so you can't get through. As a tourist you have to take the other exit, which leads to a large fenced parking lot. There are several taxi companies here that will force you to take a ride for outrageous prices. We paid 85 usD for a 10 min ride ( in comparison Uber costs 10-15 usd for the same distance)
Only once you have bought one can you and the taxi driver get past the barrier for ‚Äûfamily and friends‚Äú.
Uber is not allowed to operate from the airport. So there is no other option (apart from a public bus?) than taking a taxi for these outrageous prices. But it is possible to take an Uber to the airport.
There are even announcements at the airport confirming that the taxi companies have been approved by the government.
In my opinion it‚Äôs a total tourist ripoff that is supported by the government.

Review:
For being a fairly busy airport, it is pretty small. However the layout is very clear and signage is easy to follow.

For departures, gates are not assigned until about an hour before departure. Some are announced over speakers before they show on the screen. There is no consistency.
I have required accessibility services and the staff assigned this role are scarce.

Review: The airport is very crowded and confusing, it is hard to distinguish between official staff and conmen. We were advised by a guy wearing a uniform to take a taxi to the hotel zone which is 15 mins away from the airport.  We were told the price would be 30 USD payable by credit card.  We entered our PIN number on the display which read 30 USD but he was reluctant for us to hold the portable device so he was able to see our PIN number.  We were a bit suspicious about this so we checked our bank account when we arrived at the hotel and found a payment of ¬£268 had been taken out.  We immediately stopped our cards, fortunately we are returning to the UK so this wasn‚Äôt too inconvenient.  The ‚Äútaxi‚Äù was a red unmarked shown in the photo.  We reported to the police but they weren‚Äôt helpful (there was also several police officers in the area when the guy was operating). If you are in this situation only pay CASH to avoid being scammed and exercise caution.  We had left it too late to book a pickup online (you need 24 hours notice) but this would be the best option

Review:
The airport was good, customs was fast, and so were Immigrations. Our bags came fast, but the stroller went through over-sized baggage instead of getting it at the gate. I don't know if this is the airlines fault. Are the airport's because they damaged the side of the car seat. Over-sized baggage also took forever to come. When we got to the ride-shares lobby, this lady was being so pushy for their hotel.

Onto departures, check-in was fast and so easy we dropped our bags with the Swoop agent and handed our stroller over. Security was fast and had a very short line for a busy airport. We got to our gate very quickly and pushed back quick.

Over all 3.5/5

Review: Tried to take my prescription medication from me and it wasn‚Äôt even over 3 ounces.  I have to take a prescription in gel form.  I‚Äôll admit that it comes in a deceptively large ‚Äúbottle‚Äù for reasons that aren‚Äôt clear to me.  But it is clearly labeled ‚ÄúPrescription Only‚Äù.  It also is not even 3 ounces.  There is actually a foil pack in the bottle (picture a Capri Sun pouch) and then a pump, that maintains a vacuum so that each actuation is accurate and so there is very little waste.  I had to end up showing them my personal medical records online to finally get them to let me have it.  As a socially anxious person, this was all somewhat traumatic and very much has me questioning my desire to travel through a Mexico airport again.  I‚Äôve been questioned in US airports too, but they always quickly relent the second they see it says ‚ÄúPrescription only‚Äù.  Abraham Gonzalez was the agent.  If an airport official reads this, I encourage you to review any video you have.  Clearly your agents need better training.  I have to wonder if this wasn‚Äôt an attempt at outright theft to be honest as the medication certainly has a strong black market attraction.  I will only consider removing this review if I am contacted personally with an apology and a written plan on official letterhead on how you intend to address this with your agents.

Review: This airport is very functional without all the bells and whistles that you see in Vancouver.  They need some moving walkways for sure. Flew in tonight, flight arrived late. Had to wait for a crew to get us the tunnel attached to get off the plane. But, security was so fast coming through,  they have machines now that you scan your passport,  walk through a glass cage, get your picture taken, and it gives you a receipt (KEEP RECEIPT YOU NEED IT TO LEAVE) and poof you're done. The baggage claim however was another story. First we were told the wrong carousel,  then they started coming and stopped,  and started and stopped,  multiple times. Then the passengers could see the bags were stuck in the back and were yelling down to get someone's attention.  All in all, we had a very long day of travel.

Review: International arrival is a hit or miss depending on how many planes arrive at the same time.  Worst times are the afternoon and weekends.    We landed at 2:30 and it took 2.5 hours through immigration with a thousand people in front and back of us packed in to enter one of three entrances that fit 3 people wide.  A nightmare.   Each isle had only 2 immigration officers and isle 1 which had automated passport reading was so inaccurate they did not open it to the public and was used for special clearance of unknown usage.    Recommended you get the earliest flight in as possible.

Review:
Terrible experience flying with BA here.
Flight pushed back 15 hours with less than a days notice.
Then gets pushed back another 4 hours with no reason given. Managed to get other accommodation but have to go through rigmarole of claiming back compensation (which is a nightmare from previous experience).
Airport itself was crazy busy and has very limited seating. Staff were quite helpful and shops were adequate. Good air con which was a plus.
When we eventually got to check in, we were three hours early and there were around 100+ people already waiting. Here‚Äôs the best part, there were only TWO PEOPLE checking in everyone. Might be more of a dig at BA than the airport but what a joke. Took 1 hour just to drop luggage off.
Security moved slowly, really could look at making things so much more efficient.  Overall a terrible experiences

Review:
Airport is not bad, but‚Ä¶

Beware (!!!!!) of agents at the airport exit! They introduce themselves as authorized by the airport, but in fact, under the guise of a favorable offer for an active holiday (in our case, dolphins) for a low price (payment right there!) they lure you into a timeshare/membership presentation promising free food and drinks. They say that it will take 1.5 hours, but in reality they keep you for 3-4 hours. If you are with children, this is only to their advantage - children are tired and parents already agree to everything - at least a timeshare, at least a membership for 100 weeks in advance. If you continue to refuse, expect rude communication. Refunds for activities will also take several hours and communication with employees. In our case, it was membership in Moon Palace. Having sensed something was wrong, we did not go anywhere. The agent on the phone tried to entice us in every way. Realizing that there was no result, he simply stopped answering. We managed to get the money back through the bank by disputing the transaction. Be firm and walk past such agents at the airport with a stone face and looking only forward! Don't let them check your passport or start talking to you! Also, take care of a taxi in advance! Outside the airport you will be attacked like a flock of seagulls (very noisy and screaming) they will tell you the price is about $100, in reality it costs $30-40 maximum. Once again - go straight ahead through all these agents without reacting to anything!!

If you are with children, this is only to their advantage - children are tired and parents already agree to everything - at least a timeshare, at least a membership for 100 weeks in advance. If you continue to refuse, expect rude communication. Refunds for activities will also take several hours and communication with employees. In our case, it was membership in Moon Palace. Having sensed something was wrong, we did not go anywhere. The agent on the phone tried to encourage us in every way. Realizing that there was no result, he simply stopped answering. Don't let them check your passport or start talking to you! Also, take care of a taxi in advance! Once again - go straight ahead through all these agents without reacting to anything!!

Review:
Horrible airport that allows high profile scams of gullible tourists. There is a big, modern looking "Tourist Information" area at the exit. Its only purpose: to sell you timeshares for the Krystal Hotel. (They promise you free breakfast and 50% discount on excursions if you pay a $30 deposit. In the end you fly home with a $20,000 mistake.) DO NOT TALK TO ANYONE at the "tourist information". But I don't think that's even the worst scam going on. Inside the terminals the airport sells a can of coke for $3 (fair ish considering airport prices) but the small bottle of water will set you back $8.50(!!!) at the register.
It's a shame that your holiday starts and ends with an overcrowded tourist trap. Cancun should do better.

Review: Check your bags immediately before leaving the airport. Buyer beware! Frontier is the worst airline I have ever flown. Customer Service is horrible. We flew into Cancun on 5/18/2024 and paid for our luggage to arrive complete. When we arrived it took over an hour to receive our luggage on Carousel #4. Once we arrived at our hotel, we found out why it took so long. Our bags were ransacked and they stole 2 purses and several clothing items. We filed a claim within 4 hours of arriving and it was rejected. No reason was given. But read their baggage policy closely. They do not take responsibility. We filled out a report with the ministry of tourism. No help from the ticket agent at the Cancun Airport either. They just kept on referring me to the website stating there was nothing they could do. Make sure you check your bags once you claim them at the Carousel.

traduccion_nueva: First of all, the guard is attentive and friendly, there is no problem with that. But both the staff and the facilities leave a lot to be desired. The waiting time is too long. I had to see how several people who had already been there longer than me were leaving. There were only two executives. s attending (we are aware that there are processes that take longer) there were more bank staff but I honestly don't know what their role was, only others were talking on the cell phone. The few staff that work would recommend more training since sometimes a lack of knowledge was noticeable. In the continuation of processes, they constantly questioned what was next after this and after that. The equipment and facilities needed a remodel, the lights suddenly went out, the computers that were too slow would lose connection every so often. The executives' offices, the plastic that divides them is already too old And more organization and innovation in their methods since many banks manage the digital registration how you arrive and what you go they give you a turn here you have to sign up on a list The guard does do them a favor, but when not There are a lot of people who arrive and register and sometimes they only went for something simple like a deposit but they already lost time due to lack of staff, which there is but I don't know, see. The cashiers, well, it was just one who didn't seem to want to be there. It was two hours there. In other banks I have done the same process and it takes approximately 10-15 minutes. I didn't think that many of the reviews here were true but I can see that they go from bad to worse.
